<a href="blog_000_lupia25.html"><h3>Cutting Corners?</h3></a>
<p>Here I celebrate the 25th anniversary of Arthur Lupia's 1994 seminal article, Shorctus Versus Encyclopedias, by revisiting its central themes. Using the author's original data, I identify and explore two complications in the validity of his "knowledge" variable. These complications have major implications on how we interpret Lupia's findings.</p>
